main event: An unidentified flying object resembling a small aircraft landing light was observed by airmen at Pepperell AFB, Newfoundland on 6 February 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed visually with no optical aids or radar contact., The sighting lasted for about 25 minutes before the object disappeared below the horizon., The object was reported to be green and traveled downward at a high speed., Observations suggested the object might have been a natural phenomenon, possibly attributed to stars or a meteor., Weather conditions were generally good during the sightings.
sighted object: Unidentified flying object resembling a landing light and later described as green with a trail of sparks.
witness description: Air Force personnel including Major R. E. Fancher and other enlisted members.
